# Draft:Ankita Konwar

----
Ankita Konwar (born 1991) is an Indian fitness enthusiast, ultramarathon runner, and entrepreneur. She is known for participating in international endurance events and co-founding the Invincible Women Run, an ultra-distance event dedicated to female runners. Konwar also advocates for mental wellness and sustainable living, and is married to Indian model and actor Milind Soman.
Early life
Konwar was born in Guwahati, Assam to parents Nagen Chandra Konwar and Niranjana Borgohain. She has also spoken publicly about experiencing emotional trauma in her early life. She began her career in 2013 as a cabin crew executive with AirAsia in Malaysia.
Career
Sports and entrepreneurial ventures
Konwar has participated in fitness and endurance events alongside Milind Soman. In 2018, she completed her first full marathon of 42 kilometers in Athens. She has also taken part in ultra-distance stadium runs, ultra runs exceeding 50 kilometers, and city-to-city runs. A practitioner of yoga, she teaches and promotes its benefits.
In 2023, she founded the Invincible Women Run, an ultra-distance running event exclusively for women. In 2024, she co-authored the book Keep Moving with her husband and mother-in-law, focusing on health and relationships.
Konwar and Soman participate in an annual long-distance run at the end of the year, covering distances of over 100 kilometers between cities. They have completed this run in Sri Lanka, Japan, Tanzania, and various locations in India. In 2024, they ran from Porbandar to Dwarka in Gujarat.
Personal life
Konwar met Milind Soman in 2014 in Chennai, and after four years of dating, they married on 22 April 2018 in a private Maharashtrian ceremony in Alibag. Later that year, they also held a barefoot wedding ceremony in Spain.
Criticism
Ankita Konwar's relationship with Milind Soman has received media attention, particularly due to their age difference of nearly 26 years. Since making their relationship public, it has been a topic of discussion in the media and on social platforms. Konwar has faced criticism regarding the age gap, which both she and Soman have addressed in public statements.
